logo: Hudson Energy Dimensions & Placement : ‚Ä¢ The logo consists of a stylized "H" formed by two black rectangular shapes with a white, wavy line running diagonally through the left rectangle. ‚Ä¢ To the right of the graphic, the text "Hudson Energy" appears in bold, black font, stacked on two lines. ‚Ä¢ The logo is presented in grayscale (black and white). Analysis : ‚Ä¢ The wavy line within the "H" may symbolize energy flow or a river, aligning with the company name "Hudson Energy." ‚Ä¢ The bold, clean design suggests a modern, professional energy company identity. Box 142109 Irving, TX 75014 üí¨ Questions or Comments ‚úâ HudsonEnergyCare@hudsonenergy.net üåê www.HudsonEnergy.net 866-483-7664 Mon - Fri: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm Central Emergencies and Power Outages Call Centerpoint directly at 1-800-332-7143 The amount billed may include price changes allowed by law or regulatory action. #103 NO Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity usage history in kilowatt-hours (KWH) from September 2015 to September 2016. bar chart: Title & Axes : ‚Ä¢ Title: "Usage history (KWH)". ‚Ä¢ X-axis: Months from "Sep 15" to "Sep 16" (labels: Sep 15, Oct 15, Nov 15, Dec 15, Jan 16, Feb 16, Mar 16, Apr 16, May 16, Jun 16, Jul 16, Aug 16, Sep 16). ‚Ä¢ Y-axis: Usage in KWH, with tick marks at .100, .280, .460, .640, .820, 1.000. Data Points : ‚Ä¢ Each bar represents total KWH usage for the corresponding month. ‚Ä¢ All bars fall between approximately .640 and 1.000 KWH. ‚Ä¢ The highest bar is for Jul 16, reaching the 1.000 KWH mark. ‚Ä¢ Other months show usage between about .820 and .920 KWH, with a slight dip from Feb 16 to May 16. Design Encodings : ‚Ä¢ Bars are shaded in a uniform pattern. ‚Ä¢ No colour differentiation or multiple series. ‚Ä¢ No error bars or statistical annotations. Distribution & Trends : ‚Ä¢ Usage is relatively stable from Sep 15 to Jan 16. ‚Ä¢ There is a noticeable dip in usage from Feb 16 to May 16. ‚Ä¢ Usage increases again from Jun 16, peaking in Jul 16, then slightly decreases in Aug 16 and Sep 16. Analysis : ‚Ä¢ The data shows a seasonal pattern, with lower electricity usage in late winter to spring (Feb‚ÄìMay) and a peak in midsummer (Jul 16). ‚Ä¢ The highest usage occurs in Jul 16, possibly due to increased cooling needs. ‚Ä¢ Overall, usage fluctuates within a narrow range except for the summer peak. Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity usage history in kilowatt-hours (KWH) from September 2015 to September 2016. bar chart: Title & Axes : ‚Ä¢ Title: "Usage history (KWH)" ‚Ä¢ X-axis: Months from "Sep 15" to "Sep 16" (labels: Sep 15, Oct 15, Nov 15, Dec 15, Jan 16, Feb 16, Mar 16, Apr 16, May 16, Jun 16, Jul 16, Aug 16, Sep 16) ‚Ä¢ Y-axis: Usage in KWH, with tick labels at 0, 320, 640, 960, 1280, 1600 Data Points : ‚Ä¢ Single series: Monthly usage (exact values not labeled, but bar heights are visually comparable) ‚Ä¢ Highest bars: Oct 15, Jan 16, Jul 16, Aug 16 ‚Ä¢ Lowest bars: Mar 16, Apr 16, May 16 Design Encodings : ‚Ä¢ Vertical bars, uniform color/pattern ‚Ä¢ No gridlines or error bars ‚Ä¢ No secondary axis Distribution & Trends : ‚Ä¢ Usage fluctuates monthly, with visible peaks and troughs ‚Ä¢ Several months (Oct 15, Jan 16, Jul 16, Aug 16) have higher usage, while spring months (Mar‚ÄìMay 16) are lower Analysis : ‚Ä¢ Electricity usage is highest in early fall, mid-winter, and midsummer, suggesting seasonal variation (possibly due to heating and cooling). ‚Ä¢ The lowest usage occurs in the spring months. ‚Ä¢ There is a repeating pattern of higher usage in colder and hotter months, and lower usage in milder months.   ‚Ä¢ The logo consists of a stylized "H" formed by two black rectangular shapes with a white, wavy line running diagonally through the left rectangle.
  ‚Ä¢ To the right of the graphic, the text "Hudson Energy" appears in bold, black font, stacked on two lines.
  ‚Ä¢ The logo is presented in grayscale (black and white).

Analysis :
  ‚Ä¢ The wavy line within the "H" may symbolize energy flow or a river, aligning with the company name "Hudson Energy."
  ‚Ä¢ The bold, clean design suggests a modern, professional energy company identity.

Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity usage history in kilowatt-hours (KWH) from September 2015 to September 2016.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  ‚Ä¢ Title: "Usage history (KWH)".
  ‚Ä¢ X-axis: Months from "Sep 15" to "Sep 16" (labels: Sep 15, Oct 15, Nov 15, Dec 15, Jan 16, Feb 16, Mar 16, Apr 16, May 16, Jun 16, Jul 16, Aug 16, Sep 16).
  ‚Ä¢ Y-axis: Usage in KWH, with tick marks at .100, .280, .460, .640, .820, 1.000.

Data Points :
  ‚Ä¢ Each bar represents total KWH usage for the corresponding month.
  ‚Ä¢ All bars fall between approximately .640 and 1.000 KWH.
  ‚Ä¢ The highest bar is for Jul 16, reaching the 1.000 KWH mark.
  ‚Ä¢ Other months show usage between about .820 and .920 KWH, with a slight dip from Feb 16 to May 16.

Design Encodings :
  ‚Ä¢ Bars are shaded in a uniform pattern.
  ‚Ä¢ No colour differentiation or multiple series.
  ‚Ä¢ No error bars or statistical annotations.

Distribution & Trends :
  ‚Ä¢ Usage is relatively stable from Sep 15 to Jan 16.
  ‚Ä¢ There is a noticeable dip in usage from Feb 16 to May 16.
  ‚Ä¢ Usage increases again from Jun 16, peaking in Jul 16, then slightly decreases in Aug 16 and Sep 16.

Analysis :
  ‚Ä¢ The data shows a seasonal pattern, with lower electricity usage in late winter to spring (Feb‚ÄìMay) and a peak in midsummer (Jul 16).
  ‚Ä¢ The highest usage occurs in Jul 16, possibly due to increased cooling needs.
  ‚Ä¢ Overall, usage fluctuates within a narrow range except for the summer peak.
